title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenage boy who struggles with alienation and disillusionment after being expelled from prep school.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a future society where government surveillance, censorship, and propaganda are omnipresent.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The epic story of Frodo Baggins, a hobbit who must destroy a powerful ring to save Middle-earth from the evil Sauron.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: The story of Elizabeth Bennet, a young woman living in 19th century England, and her relationship with the wealthy Mr. Darcy.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The story of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on a quest to reclaim treasure from the dragon Smaug with a group of dwarves and the wizard Gandalf.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel about a young man named Dorian Gray, who remains eternally young while a portrait of him ages and reflects the moral decay of his actions.

title: To the Lighthouse
author: Virginia Woolf
description: The story of the Ramsay family and their visits to the Isle of Skye, exploring themes of perception, relationships, and the passage of time.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsession with hunting down the white whale Moby-Dick, exploring themes of nature, revenge, and the human spirit.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: The story of a young Andalusian shepherd named Santiago who travels in search of a treasure, learning important life lessons along the way.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem that follows the Greek hero Odysseus on his ten-year journey home after the fall of Troy, encountering mythical creatures and facing numerous challenges.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a future society where human reproduction is controlled, emotions are suppressed, and citizens are conditioned to be content with their roles.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: The story of Jane Eyre, an orphan who becomes a governess and falls in love with her employer, Mr. Rochester, while facing challenges and discovering her own identity.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: The psychological novel follows the story of Rodion Raskolnikov, a poor ex-student in Saint Petersburg, and his moral dilemmas after committing a murder.

title: The Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: The bildungsroman novel follows the life of an orphan named Pip, his encounters with various characters, and his pursuit of becoming a gentleman.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel that explores complex themes such as religion, morality, and the nature of evil through the story of the Karamazov family.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: The story of Huck Finn, a young boy who escapes his abusive father and embarks on a journey down the Mississippi River with a runaway slave named Jim.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The multigenerational story of the Buendía family, set in the fictional town of Macondo, blending magical realism with themes of love, solitude, and the cyclical nature of time.
